main.name: Achraf Tarifa
main.bio: Use this bio section as your way of describing yourself and saying what you do, what technologies you like to use or feel most comfortable with, describing your personality, or whatever else you feel like throwing in.
main.contactmessage: Whatever the nature of your project, do not hesitate to contact me by e-mail, phone or on LinkedIn.

education.description: 2 years of algebra and physics before passing the national entrance exam to engineering schools

work.title: Front-end devoloper
work.description: After finishing my React learning path at codecademy the summer internship was the best opportunity to apply what I learned and improve my web development skills, so Rankio was the best choice for me. Rankio is a SAAS application that facilitates project prioritization. I was a frontend developer in a team of four, we applied scrum as a project management methodology. This opportunity allowed me not only to learn more about React but also to become a better web developer by using bootstrap as a CSS framework, integrating the API and working with professionals in the same team. luckily the trip didn’t end after finishing my 2 months internship, in fact after my hard work and impressive performance the Rankio team invited me to continue the journey as a freelancer to work on both front and back end tasks.
work.keywords: React, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, Bootstrap, GIT, Docker

work.title: Back-end devoloper
work.description: My first work experience was with perfaxis which is a Tunisian IT company, active in software publishing and IT consulting. My mission was to develop and document user stories for automoto.tn through a PostgreSQL database and a REST web service written in Node JS, in Docker containers. After only one year of computer science study it wasn’t easy to accomplish such advanced tasks, not forgetting to mention that it was my first experience with git, node and docker. but after a lot of research and  with the help of my supervisors I was able to finish all my tasks in time.
work.keywords: Node, Javascript, Express, PostgreSQL, Docker, GIT, HTTP, Swagger

projects.name: Reseach Lab
projects.keywords: Angular, Spring Boot, Java, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, Material ui

projects.name: Security check system
projects.description: A facial authentication system that uses the comparative method The system will learn the authorized faces and their names, then we will use a video as an input. It could be a live cam or a recorded video We will use a face detection function, which will detect if there is at least a face in the video source if a face is found, the system will take some frames from the video to compare the face with faces from the database if the face is identified and authorized the system will give permission to the person to enter and send a notification mail mentioning the individual's name to the admin, otherwise the system will not authorize this person and will send a notification mail containing one of the frames with the individual photo.

projects.name: People Counter
projects.description: Get statistics of your pictures with your friends & family (Collaboration IEEE CIS ENIS SB et DataColab).

communitylife.title: Project manager
communitylife.description: As a project manager my mission was to supervise and assure the continuity and progression of the IEEE ENIS Student Branch projects. I was responsible for planning, organizing and directing the completion of various projects. Not only that, but I was part in organizing different events and workshops for the IEEE ENIS SB members. This experience helped me to learn how to communicate with team members and how to manage a group of motivated people.

communitylife.title: Web master
communitylife.description: As the CIS webmaster I was responsible for the CIS media content. This role gave me the opportunity to organize and participate in different AI related workshops and events and I was able to be a part of different projects in a collaboration with DataColab.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
